Author: LotsofSports

Comment: I don't think that he gets that the rest of the world will keep on freely trading with each other as usual, and some countries may surpass the U.S. in GDP.   Or that companies may start to invest elsewhere.  A part of his game seems to be to get foreign business to invest and build in the U.S., but this could backfire.  It is also a possibility that U.S. companies move to do more business in other countries.  GM and Ford could just start shipping more vehicles directly from Mexico, Brazil, China, or Eastern Europe to the rest of the world as examples.  This would bypass U.S. export penalties and other U.S. centric cost spikes and would be less of a political headache.   So, even though they may still be headquartered in Detroit, they can move production, profit, and maybe even R&D outside of the U.S.  I am not saying that this exact scenario would play out, but these countries, just like Trump and Musk, really do only care about their bottom lines and participating in the global economy is what they do.  3M, Honeywell, Boeing, Raytheon, Target, Exxon, and on and on are players on the global market.  Fuck, even Musk relies on the global economy.
